results.title: Panacea - the Soundtrack
results.brief_description:
A cast of ten, a teenage boy, live musicians, full musical score, six projection surfaces, digital animation and a sublime visual setting, mark this production as the largest ever produced by Arena.

Music Director: Hugh Covill
Music composed by: Hugh Covill with Rosemary Myers and Dave Watts

results.title: Panacea - The Documentary
results.brief_description: Panacea the Documentary follows the journey of Arena Theatre Company’s creative team as they embark on an ambitious large scale perfromance event fusing modern technology and cinematic devices. We follow the journey of the team as they wrestle with combining conventional theatre and MTV culture.

results.title: Panacea
results.brief_description:
The pursuit of the utopian dream has no boundaries. Synthetic performance in a synthetic existence. Athlete as guinea pig, sportfields as laboratories. We’re all taking something - something to make us happier, stronger, calmer, faster…

Lost in the landscape of delusion and hullucination, super-strength and super-stress, the euphoric wins and unbearable losses - is a 13 year old boy. A boy destroyed by drug technology beyond the control of its administrator, his swimming coach - mentor, father figure and Frankenstein.

Panacea looks at the personal and political world of drugs - their design, use and implications. Liberating constrained definitions for ‘drugs’. Panacea will confront a nation’s love of sport, the pysche of winning, the media’s need for a hero, and the ambiguity of drug taking for medicine, profit or performance.

results.title: Pan-Pacific jamboree
results.creator_credit: Herschells Films and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Presents a scout’s account of activities at an International Boy Scout Jamboree held near Melbourne. He mentions the friends he makes, demonstrates folk dancing given by groups of scouts, daily chores, the big parade and popular past-times such as autograph hunting.

results.title: Pals & Sals (PC)
results.brief_description: This CD ROM is designed for VCE language programmes in both primary and secondary settings. It contains excerpts of the 1996 PALS and SALS satellite broadcasts (as seen on Sofnet), and the materials contained meets Victorian LOTE CSF and VCE standards. SYSTEM REQUIREMENTS: Multimedia PC that includes a 386SX or higher, at least 4MB of RAM, 2.5MB of available hard disk space, CD-ROM drive, audio board and VGA or VGA+. MS DOS and Microsoft Windows operating system version 3.1 or later.

results.title: Palooka
results.creator_credit: Edward Small Productions, Reliance Pictures, Edward Small and Benjamin Stoloff
results.brief_description: Raw comedy drama based on Ham Fisher’s famous comic strip. Jimmy Durante plays the sometimes obnoxious and sleazy boxing manager Knobby Walsh as he goes about trying to exploit his up and coming protogee, the young and naive Joe Palooka (Stuart Erwin) to figh tthe current champion, Al McSwatt (played by James Cagney’s look alike brother, William Cagney). Also stars Lupe Velez, Marjorie Rambeau, Robert Armstrong and Mary Carlisle.

results.title: Palm Beach
results.creator_credit: Albie Thoms Productions and Albie Thoms
results.brief_description: A quasi-documentary fiction film about the suburban sub-culture of of Sydney’s northern beach areas. It is, simultaneously, a fast-paced thriller involving surf, drugs and rock n roll. Forty eight hours in the lives of a handful of young Australians. Paul was looking for work … Joe was looking on. Stars Nat Young and Bryan Brown. Rated: M

results.title: Palio
results.creator_credit: Michael Weigall Productions and Michael Weigall
results.brief_description: Shows “The Palio”, a wild horse race representing Siena’s seventeen districts. Held in a mediaeval square, it was inaugurated in the 18th century by Violanta of Medici as a safety valve for local factions continuing to this day, and is dubbed as the world’s only political horse race.

results.title: Palette of glass
results.brief_description: Shows the creation of a set of stained glass windows for the Art Institute of Chicago, tracing the project from design to installation. Illustrates the fascinating collaboration between the artist, Marc Chagall, and the glass-maker to produce such wonderful designs. Spoken in English and French (with English subtitles). Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.
